revised_title: Effect of Temperature on Equilibrium Pressure in Fatty Substances
tldr: This study investigates the effect of temperature on the equilibrium pressure of fatty substances, focusing on the behavior of crystals and lenses of fats on the surface of water. The authors found that increasing temperature affects the two-dimensional equilibrium pressure and that the stability of unimolecular films depends on the temperature and pressure. The findings provide insights into the stability of unimolecular films in general.
